Marxist Feminism.title: The Anti-Social Family
Marxist Feminism.description: Sensitive but uncompromising socialist-feminist critique of the nuclear family
Marxist Feminism.review: An extremely brave, and with the benefit of hindsight, what must appear to be a very daring critique of the family.

Marxist Feminism.title: Fortunes of Feminism
Marxist Feminism.description: Charts the history of women's liberation and calls for a revitalized feminism.
Marxist Feminism.review: Nancy Fraser is among the very few thinkers in the tradition of critical theory who are capable of redeeming its legacy in the twenty-first century.

Marxist Feminism.title: The Erotic Margin
Marxist Feminism.description: Reviewing the large, disparate, and often contradictory western discourse on gender and sexuality of the Other
Marxist Feminism.review: Schick explores the netherworld of ethnopornographic sources, then returns to high ground with a theory of alterist discourse that opens new horizons for eveyone interested in representations of the Other. I know of no other work that theorizes the exoticization and eroticization of the Other with such rigor or such far-reaching implications.
